item.title: Writing Exams
item.description:
Writing Exams

Exams can cause a lot of stress! Especially if you are new to writing them.

Join us in this workshop which explores strategies for answering different types of exam questions. Participants will learn about typical exam procedures, strategies and guidelines for maintaining integrity when writing exams, and strategies for maximizing post exam reflection. There is also an opportunity to reflect on your test-taking mindset.

From Friday, April 4, 2025 1:00 PM to 2:00 PM EDT at Online.

item.title: Outbound Pre-Departure Session for Exchange and Double Degree Students
item.description:
Outbound Pre-Departure Session for Exchange and Double Degree Students

Participating on an international experience is a journey, both physically and emotionally. Though you have probably heard this many times, it is important to acknowledge that spending time in another country can have a profound impact on your life. Even if this isn't your first time traveling, every journey has the potential to offer new, life-changing experiences.

The pre-departure period is an important process that can take many months as you prepare for the journey ahead. The session will include components of the pre-departure process that will focus on cultural awareness; Travel safety and preparedness; being a Brock Ambassador; academics, health matters, financial information, etc. all while being joined by other Brock students who are embarking an exchange next year, as well. You will also have the chance to connect with returned exchange students, some of which may have been to the same country you are going to, as well as students from those countries who are here on their exchange.

Pre-departure is an important and mandatory component of your outbound program that will best prepare you for the journey ahead.

You are welcome to bring a guest/supporter (i.e. a parent), (note: they do not need to register, but please add them as a guest in your registration to help us track numbers). This session is also a great opportunity for them to learn about this important preparation information.

From Saturday, April 5, 2025 9:00 AM to 3:00 PM EDT at STH203 .

item.description:

The English Students' Association (ESA) is proud to announce our upcoming Undergraduate Academic Conference, in Pond Inlet (MCJ) on Saturday April 5 at 1pm-5:30pm (the day after the final day of classes). 

Students will present their 10-15 minute papers over the course of three panels, with a Q-&-A segment for each. Snacks will be provided. Attendance is open to everyone (you do not have to be a Brock student). 

This is a great way to find out about the academic conference scene, especially for students considering graduate studies in the future. We look forward to seeing you there!

From Saturday, April 5, 2025 1:00 PM to 5:30 PM EDT at Pond Inlet (Mackenzie Chown J-Block).

item.title: Bioarchaeology & Anatomy Workshop
item.description:
Bioarchaeology & Anatomy Workshop

Join Dr. Parker Holman from the Department of Kinesiology for this workshop especially organized for Classics and Archaeology Majors and Minors. Participants will have a tour of the human anatomy lab, the cutting-edge technology used in KINE lab courses, and the anatomy collections. The workshop will focus on an anatomy-based activity. No prior knowledge or experience is needed. Students will also be advised about which KINE courses are available for taking in the future. This could be your first step to developing a new skill to complement your Classics and Archaeology background.

Spaces are limited. Classics Majors and Minors will be given some priority if overbooked.


To signup/join the waitlist, register here: https://forms.office.com/r/K0m7WgyEg5 

From Monday, April 7, 2025 11:00 AM to 12:00 PM EDT at BU Anatomy Lab (CRN 310).

item.title: Integrity Office @BU ** For Students ** Your Questions Answered
item.description:
Integrity Office @BU ** For Students ** Your Questions Answered

Hello!

Our Academic Integrity Policy was amended and approved on April 17, 2024. Join me to discuss important amendments made to the policy such as:
How procedural fairness is documented and reviewed; access and management of evidence; process and communication protocols; external sources of misconduct; the educational approach in academic misconduct @BU; and other aspects of policy management. This event is open to everyone... instructors, TAs, students, and non-teaching staff. Have your questions ready! You are welcome to join every week or pick the week that fits your schedule.

** FOR STUDENTS:
This session will focus exclusively on the Academic Integrity Policy and aspects of policy management outside the scope of Learning Services. If you have been asked to complete a workshop hosted by Learning Services, please follow the registration process when browsing the events list posted on ExperienceBU. **

With kind regards and see you soon!

Ana Cassamali
Academic Integrity Manager | Academic Integrity Office
acassamali@brocku.ca
Brock University
Niagara Region | 1812 Sir Isaac Brock Way | St. Catharines, Ontario L2S 3A1
brocku.ca | T 905 688 5550

 

From Monday, April 7, 2025 11:00 AM to 12:00 PM EDT at Online.
item.author: acassamali@brocku.ca (Academic Integrity Week)

item.title: Professional Prospectives
item.description:
Professional Prospectives

Looking to connect with industry professionals and gain valuable career insights?

Join us in celebrating David D’Lancy Wilson as he steps into the rich legacy of The Lion King! With an impressive background in theatre and film—Harry Potter and the Cursed Child, Hairspray, Designated Survivor, V-Wars, and more—David’s journey is nothing short of inspiring.

This is a unique opportunity to learn from a seasoned industry professional, hear firsthand about his career journey, and gain insights into the world of theatre and entertainment. From the stage to the screen, David’s passion and dedication shine through every role he takes on. His talent has captivated audiences in productions like Reefer Madness, Riot, and Good Sam, and now he embarks on an exciting new chapter.

A true testament to perseverance and artistry, he does it all for Shannon and their cubs.

Don’t miss out on this chance to be inspired, learn from an accomplished artist, and connect with others passionate about the arts!

From Monday, April 7, 2025 12:00 PM to 2:00 PM EDT at TH131 Across Market Hall.

item.title: HLSC Winter Research Symposium
item.description:
HLSC Winter Research Symposium

The HLSC Undergraduate Research Symposium offers an unparalleled opportunity to immerse yourself in the cutting edge of health innovation, research, and discovery. This dynamic event unites passionate students, visionary community leaders, dedicated faculty members, and inspiring speakers to showcase groundbreaking research, explore diverse career pathways, and address today’s most pressing health challenges.

Experience engaging presentations and poster sessions where students present their latest research findings.

Whether you're sharing your work or simply attending, this is your chance to connect, collaborate, and ignite your passion for health innovation. Don’t miss this extraordinary event—register today and help shape the future of health!

 

*Just a brief disclaimer from Marketing and Communications:
By registering for this event, you acknowledge that you are entering an area where photography, audio and video recording may occur. 

This registration and your entry and presence on the event premises constituents your consent to be photographed, filmed, and/or otherwise recorded and to the release, publication, exhibition or reproduction of any and all recorded media of your appearance, voice and name for any purpose whatsoever in perpetuity in connection with Brock University and its initiatives, including, by way of example only, use on websites, in social media, news and advertising. 

If you do not agree to the foregoing, please do not enter the event premises.

From Monday, April 7, 2025 8:00 AM to 3:00 PM EDT at Pond Inlet.

item.title: Graduate Writing and Academic Support Drop-ins
item.description:
Graduate Writing and Academic Support Drop-ins

All graduate students are welcome to stop by our drop-in support sessions every Tuesday from 11am-1pm, either online or in person. No appointment necessary. Sessions are limited to 30 minutes (or 20 minutes if students are waiting). First come, first served. 

 

Our Graduate Academic Support Specialist will be available every week to help with writing and general academic skills. 

 

There may also be special topic weeks with other Support Specialists available (see list below). If you would like to see other supports available during these drop-ins, please contact Danielle Morris-O'Connor (dmorrisoconnor@brocku.ca) to make a request. 

 

Weekly Supports: 

  • Academic Writing 
  • Presentations 
  • Proposals 
  • Literature Reviews 
  • Time Management 
  • Note-taking 
  • Reading Strategies 
  • Utilizing Feedback 

Special Supports: 

  • Conference presentations and posters 
  • GRADflix feedback 

From Tuesday, April 8, 2025 11:00 AM to 1:00 PM EDT at RFP 216/Online.
item.author: graduatestudies@brocku.ca (Faculty of Graduate Studies)

item.title: Systematic and Scoping Reviews : Setting your team up for success (Workshop 1)
item.description:
Systematic and Scoping Reviews : Setting your team up for success (Workshop 1)

Planning an evidence synthesis (e.g. systematic/scoping reviews, meta-analyses) project? Brock Library offers a three-part interactive workshop series for faculty-led teams who have a research questions and are ready to start their project! 

Each team will be paired with a librarian for personalized support, culminating in a completed evidence synthesis work plan. For optimal outcomes, attendance at all three online sessions is important.  

Registration opens Monday, March 10.  

Space is limited to 5 research teams, although multiple team members may attend. Only one team member needs to register for their team. Questions: dsmith@brocku.ca 

Presented by Brock Librarians: Kymberly Ash, Denise Smith, Sonia Dhaliwal, and Elizabeth Yates.

This workshop is part of a series. Registration for this workshop includes you in all three workshops in this series. Workshop dates are April 8, 22, & May 6 12-1:30pm.

From Tuesday, April 8, 2025 12:00 PM to 1:30 PM EDT at Online.
item.author: libhelp@brocku.ca (Brock Library)

item.title: Immigration In-Person Appointments
item.description:
Immigration In-Person Appointments

Are you an international student? Do you have questions about your immigration documents (study permit, work permit, visa, eTA) or work eligibility in Canada?  If so, book an appointment at the Brock International Centre!

 

How to book a time?

 

  1. One day before the advising session, book your specific time slot 
  • You will not be able to see time slots any earlier than 7 days beforehand
  • Time slots are first come, first served
  • If your schedule changes, please remember to cancel so that the appointment is available for another student

 

  1. Arrive at the International Centre(2nd Floor) at least 5 minutes before your time slot and feel free to sit in one of the available chairs in the welcome reception area while you wait for the immigration advisor to come greet you.

 

You will have the opportunity to meet one of Brock International's licensed immigration advisors and ask questions about your immigration documents/process in a 1-on-1 setting!

From Tuesday, April 8, 2025 2:00 PM to 3:00 PM EDT at Brock International Centre 2nd Floor.

Safe Sport to Safeguarding: Empowering Sport Leaders

Don't miss your chance to register for the Safe Sport to Safeguarding: Empowering Sport Leaders event. You will connect, learn, and collaborate with professionals, researchers, and students who are committed to making a difference in the sporting community.

Join our outstanding line-up of panelists in an engaging evening of discussion on April 8th. Experts from various sports, competitive levels, and organizational backgrounds will share valuable insights on safeguarding practices:

➡️ Coach Tony, Founder of Young and Gifted Niagara
➡️ Michael Okeke, Varsity Athlete – Brock Basketball
➡️ Isaiah Clelland, Graduate Student - Brock Sport Management
➡️ Aabroo Kaur, Medical Student [Sports Therapy and Training] – University of Toronto
➡️ Stevey Hildebrand, MEd, CHRP, Parent to a Student-Athlete
➡️ Dr. Julie Stevens, Full Professor - Brock Sport Management
➡️ Dr. Taylor McKee, Assistant Professor – Brock Sport Management
➡️ Zach Heipel, PhD Student – Brock Sport Management

Key Discussions:

✅The current state of safe sport implementation across different levels of competition
✅The critical role of sport in athlete protection and well-being
✅Understanding the distinction between safe sport and safeguarding
✅How organizations can effectively integrate safeguarding strategies
✅Expert panelists’ perspectives on the future of safeguarding in sport

Save your spot here: https://www.eventbrite.ca/e/safe-sport-to-safeguarding-empowering-sport-leaders-tickets-1279782607229?utm-campaign=social&utm-content=attendeeshare&utm-medium=discovery&utm-term=listing&utm-source=cp&aff=ebdsshcopyurl

From Tuesday, April 8, 2025 7:00 PM to 9:00 PM EDT at Brock University .

item.title: Immigration In-Person Appointments
item.description:
Immigration In-Person Appointments

Are you an international student? Do you have questions about your immigration documents (study permit, work permit, visa, eTA) or work eligibility in Canada?  If so, book an appointment at the Brock International Centre!

 

How to book a time?

 

  1. One day before the advising session, book your specific time slot 
  • You will not be able to see time slots any earlier than 7 days beforehand
  • Time slots are first come, first served
  • If your schedule changes, please remember to cancel so that the appointment is available for another student

 

  1. Arrive at the International Centre(2nd Floor) at least 5 minutes before your time slot and feel free to sit in one of the available chairs in the welcome reception area while you wait for the immigration advisor to come greet you.

 

You will have the opportunity to meet one of Brock International's licensed immigration advisors and ask questions about your immigration documents/process in a 1-on-1 setting!

item.title: For Instructors & TAs: Academic Integrity Office: What do you need to know | Virtual Drop In
item.description:
For Instructors & TAs: Academic Integrity Office: What do you need to know | Virtual Drop In

For Instructors & TAs: Academic Integrity Office: What do you need to know | Virtual Drop In

Academic Integrity Office @BU | Virtual Teams Drop In Event

Policy Management Framework
1. Our Academic Integrity Policy (April 17, 2024)
2. How procedural fairness is documented at BU
3. The "educational approach" in academic misconduct: limitations, opt-out option, realistic expectations

Responsibilities
4. Responsibilities to detect academic misconduct and assist with investigations
5. Investigation toolbox: best practices, strategies and tools
6. Framework and access to evidence (removing the “probability” argument)

Networks and External Context
7. What do we discuss in academic integrity networks, experts, and different views
8. GenAI Literacy: Beyond the “allow/not-allow” pointer
9. Contract Cheating threats and cybersecurity
10. The next frontier in academic misconduct and risks for organizations

This is a Teams event.

With kind regards and see you soon!

Ana Cassamali
Academic Integrity Manager | Academic Integrity Office
Maxient - Academic Integrity Portal Administrator
Network Memberships: ICAI - ENAI - AICO

acassamali@brocku.ca

item.title: Mapping New Knowledges (MNK) Research Conference
item.description:
Mapping New Knowledges (MNK) Research Conference

Mapping New Knowledges (MNK) is our annual research conference that provides a welcoming and supportive environment for graduate students to showcase the exceptional research happening at Brock. Students in both Master’s and PhD level programs can present in MNK (research or course-based). Postdoctoral fellows and visiting researchers are also able to present. There are three presentation types: oral, poster, and proposal. Presenter registration is open until March 9.

 

Not ready to present your research? You can still attend MNK! All graduate students in course- and research-based programs at Brock are encouraged to attend to support their peers and learn about the exciting research taking place by students on our campus. MNK is a great place to meet students outside your discipline and feel connected to the larger graduate studies community. Please make sure you register for the conference as an attendee.

 

Accessibility:

The Goodman Atrium is on the ground floor of the Goodman School of Business building, which has accessible entrances. Goodman classrooms are on the ground and second floor, and are next to accessible washrooms, water bottle filling stations, and the main elevator. FGSPA staff will be available throughout the event at the registration desk in the Goodman Atrium to provide assistance. If you have any specific accommodation requests, please reach out to Stacia Heaton at sheaton@brocku.ca. 

From Wednesday, April 9, 2025 8:30 AM to 4:00 PM EDT at Goodman Atrium (keynote and poster presentations) & Goodman Classrooms (oral and poster presentations) .
item.location: Goodman Atrium (keynote and poster presentations) & Goodman Classrooms (oral and poster presentations)

item.title: RBC Culture & Discovery Day for Students 2025
item.description:
RBC Culture & Discovery Day for Students 2025

Job Summary

Job Description

RBC is a premier investment bank that provides a focused set of products and services to corporations, institutional investors, and governments around the world. With more than 7,100 professionals, we operate out of 58 offices in 16 countries across North America, the U.K., Europe, and the Asia-Pacific region. We work with clients in over 100 countries around the globe to deliver the expertise and execution required to raise capital, access markets, mitigate risk and acquire or dispose of assets.

At RBC, we believe an inclusive workplace that has diverse perspectives is core to our continued growth as one of the largest and most successful banks in the world.

What Is This Event?

*This RBC event is a not a job opportunity/internship.

At RBC, we believe that we have a truly unique culture where all employees have the opportunity to bring their best self and achieve their full potential.

At RBC Culture & Discovery Day for Students 2025, we will share more about why this is an exceptional place to work and provide opportunities to learn more about our business and grow your network. The virtual program will expose first year university and college students in Canada to RBC’s culture and provide opportunities to network across all businesses and levels.  

On Thursday, April 10th, 2025, Join us for an interactive session with our Early Talent team and Business Reps from RBC! You’ll have the opportunity to learn about our teams, culture, and what makes us Canada’s #1 Bank.

ALL first-year university/college students studying full-time at a Canadian university/college are encouraged to register!

What Do You Need To Register?

  • Enrollment in a full-time undergraduate program at an accredited university or college in Canada with an expected graduation date between December 2027 - Spring 2028*

*This event is open to all first-year university and college students from all academic programs (Business, Commerce/Finance, STEAM (Science, Technology, Engineering, Arts, and Math), and others).

Application Process & Timeline

  • Friday, April 4th,11:59 pm ET: application deadline
  • Apply online with your resume (PDF file format preferred)
  • Thursday, April 10th, 1:00 - 3:30pm ET:  RBC Culture & Discovery Day for Students online via WebEx

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • Interact with leaders who support your development through coaching and managing in a thoughtful and open way
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Opportunity to develop broad exposure to RBC and gain an inside look at how the RBC business works
  • Opportunity to build and maintain a strong network across the Bank and interact with various levels of the organization

Job Skills

Communication, Computer Literacy, Detail-Oriented, Interpersonal Relationships, Listening Effectively, Personal Development, Personal Initiative

Additional Job Details

Address:

ROYAL BANK PLAZA, 200 BAY ST:TORONTO

City:

TORONTO

Country:

Canada

Work hours/week:

37.5

Employment Type:

Full time

Platform:

HUMAN RESOURCES & BMCC

Job Type:

Student/Coop (Fixed Term)

Pay Type:

Salaried

Posted Date:

2025-03-28

Application Deadline:

2025-04-04

Note: Applications will be accepted until 11:59 PM on the day prior to the application deadline date above

Inclusion and Equal Opportunity Employment

At RBC, we believe an inclusive workplace that has diverse perspectives is core to our continued growth as one of the largest and most successful banks in the world. Maintaining a workplace where our employees feel supported to perform at their best, effectively collaborate, drive innovation, and grow professionally helps to bring our Purpose to life and create value for our clients and communities. RBC strives to deliver this through policies and programs intended to foster a workplace based on respect, belonging and opportunity for all.

Join our Talent Community

Stay in-the-know about great career opportunities at RBC. Sign up and get customized info on our latest jobs, career tips and Recruitment events that matter to you.

Expand your limits and create a new future together at RBC. Find out how we use our passion and drive to enhance the well-being of our clients and communities at jobs.rbc.com.

From Thursday, April 10, 2025 1:00 PM to 3:30 PM EDT at Online.

item.title: Mementos: A Production by DART 4D56/Peregrine Theatre Co.
item.description:
Mementos: A Production by DART 4D56/Peregrine Theatre Co.

Department of Dramatic Arts and Peregrine Theatre Co. (DART 4D56) present:

Mementos

April 10-12, 2025

April 10th, 7:30 p.m.
April 11th, 7:30 p.m.
April 12th, 2:00 p.m. & 7:30 p.m.

Marilyn I. Walker Theatre, Marilyn I. Walker School of Fine and Performing Arts,
15 Artists’ Common, St. Catharines, ON

Through fragmented pieces of different stories, Mementos attempts to capture the complexities of the human experience, and how that continues to change, for the better or for the worse. Although these stories are splintered, they attempt to tell the story of the greater whole, analyzing what exactly makes us human. These character’s lives are full of love, loss, and uncertainty, and the audience takes the role of an onlooker as we follow their brief journeys through the play.

Content Advisory:
Mental illness, suicide, strong language, loss of a loved one.

Tickets can be purchased at brocku.universitytickets.com. 

From Thursday, April 10, 2025 7:30 PM to Saturday, April 12, 2025 7:30 PM EDT at Marilyn I. Walker School of Fine and Performing Arts.

item.title: For Instructors & TAs: Academic Integrity Office: What do you need to know | Virtual Drop In
item.description:
For Instructors & TAs: Academic Integrity Office: What do you need to know | Virtual Drop In

For Instructors & TAs: Academic Integrity Office: What do you need to know | Virtual Drop In

Academic Integrity Office @BU | Virtual Teams Drop In Event

Policy Management Framework
1. Our Academic Integrity Policy (April 17, 2024)
2. How procedural fairness is documented at BU
3. The "educational approach" in academic misconduct: limitations, opt-out option, realistic expectations

Responsibilities
4. Responsibilities to detect academic misconduct and assist with investigations
5. Investigation toolbox: best practices, strategies and tools
6. Framework and access to evidence (removing the “probability” argument)

Networks and External Context
7. What do we discuss in academic integrity networks, experts, and different views
8. GenAI Literacy: Beyond the “allow/not-allow” pointer
9. Contract Cheating threats and cybersecurity
10. The next frontier in academic misconduct and risks for organizations

This is a Teams event.

With kind regards and see you soon!

Ana Cassamali
Academic Integrity Manager | Academic Integrity Office
Maxient - Academic Integrity Portal Administrator
Network Memberships: ICAI - ENAI - AICO

acassamali@brocku.ca
Brock University
Niagara Region | 1812 Sir Isaac Brock Way | St. Catharines, Ontario L2S 3A1
brocku.ca | T 905 688 5550

item.description:
Integrity Office @BU ** For Students ** Your Questions Answered

Hello!

Our Academic Integrity Policy was amended and approved on April 17, 2024. Join me to discuss important amendments made to the policy such as:
How procedural fairness is documented and reviewed; access and management of evidence; process and communication protocols; external sources of misconduct; the educational approach in academic misconduct @BU; and other aspects of policy management. This event is open to everyone... instructors, TAs, students, and non-teaching staff. Have your questions ready! You are welcome to join every week or pick the week that fits your schedule.

item.title: Shining a Light on Cell Signalling: Investigation of the Mechanisms that Drive Cancer and Neurodegeneration
item.description:
Shining a Light on Cell Signalling: Investigation of the Mechanisms that Drive Cancer and Neurodegeneration

Join us Tuesday April 15, 2025 from 11:00 a.m. - 12:00 p.m. 

VPMI - Inniskillin Hall - IH 222/222a

Speaker: 

Aleksandar Necakov, PhD
Associate Professor, Brock University
Biological Sciences Department

Title: 

Shining a Light on Cell Signalling: Investigation of the Mechanisms that Drive Cancer and Neurodegeneration

Abstract:

Multicellular development is shaped by the integrated action of a wide range of highly conserved cell signalling pathways that coordinate neighbouring cells in the generation of tissues, organs, and entire organisms. The complex, interconnected architecture of cellular signalling networks, however, has posed formidable challenges to understanding how cells process and integrate information. The Notch receptor is a titratable, context-specific imediator of signalling between neighbouring cells that controls many aspects of cell fate, and which plays a central role in many human diseases including cancer and neurodegeneration. We study the mechanisms that regulate Notch signalling in multiple contexts using state-of-the-art live imaging techniques and novel molecular-genetic tools that allow us to observe, control, and quantify cell signalling using light. This approach has led to our recent discovery of the importance of molecular self-assembly in the integration of Notch signalling into the cell signalling networks that drive human disease.  

From Tuesday, April 15, 2025 11:00 AM to 12:00 PM EDT at VPMI - Inniskillin Hall - IH 222/222a.

item.title: Immigration In-Person Appointments
item.description:
Immigration In-Person Appointments

Are you an international student? Do you have questions about your immigration documents (study permit, work permit, visa, eTA) or work eligibility in Canada?  If so, book an appointment at the Brock International Centre!

 

How to book a time?

 

  1. One day before the advising session, book your specific time slot 
  • You will not be able to see time slots any earlier than 7 days beforehand
  • Time slots are first come, first served
  • If your schedule changes, please remember to cancel so that the appointment is available for another student

 

  1. Arrive at the International Centre(2nd Floor) at least 5 minutes before your time slot and feel free to sit in one of the available chairs in the welcome reception area while you wait for the immigration advisor to come greet you.

 

You will have the opportunity to meet one of Brock International's licensed immigration advisors and ask questions about your immigration documents/process in a 1-on-1 setting!

From Tuesday, April 15, 2025 1:30 PM to 2:30 PM EDT at Brock International Centre 2nd Floor.

item.title: Integrity Office @BU ** For Students ** Your Questions Answered
item.description:
Integrity Office @BU ** For Students ** Your Questions Answered

Hello!

Our Academic Integrity Policy was amended and approved on April 17, 2024. Join me to discuss important amendments made to the policy such as:
How procedural fairness is documented and reviewed; access and management of evidence; process and communication protocols; external sources of misconduct; the educational approach in academic misconduct @BU; and other aspects of policy management. This event is open to everyone... instructors, TAs, students, and non-teaching staff. Have your questions ready! You are welcome to join every week or pick the week that fits your schedule.

** FOR STUDENTS:
This session will focus exclusively on the Academic Integrity Policy and aspects of policy management outside the scope of Learning Services. If you have been asked to complete a workshop hosted by Learning Services, please follow the registration process when browsing the events list posted on ExperienceBU. **

With kind regards and see you soon!

Ana Cassamali
Academic Integrity Manager | Academic Integrity Office
acassamali@brocku.ca
Brock University
Niagara Region | 1812 Sir Isaac Brock Way | St. Catharines, Ontario L2S 3A1
brocku.ca | T 905 688 5550

 

From Tuesday, April 22, 2025 9:00 AM to 10:00 AM EDT at Online.

item.description:
Graduate Writing Café

Writing Café is a space to work alongside other grad students. There is also a writing specialist available, if you need help. Free snacks and hot beverages will be provided.

item.title: Graduate Writing and Academic Support Drop-ins
item.description:
Graduate Writing and Academic Support Drop-ins

All graduate students are welcome to stop by our drop-in support sessions every Tuesday from 11am-1pm, either online or in person. No appointment necessary. Sessions are limited to 30 minutes (or 20 minutes if students are waiting). First come, first served. 

 

Our Graduate Academic Support Specialist will be available every week to help with writing and general academic skills. 

 

There may also be special topic weeks with other Support Specialists available (see list below). If you would like to see other supports available during these drop-ins, please contact Danielle Morris-O'Connor (dmorrisoconnor@brocku.ca) to make a request. 

 

Weekly Supports: 

  • Academic Writing 
  • Presentations 
  • Proposals 
  • Literature Reviews 
  • Time Management 
  • Note-taking 
  • Reading Strategies 
  • Utilizing Feedback 

From Tuesday, April 22, 2025 11:00 AM to 1:00 PM EDT at RFP 216/Online.
item.author: graduatestudies@brocku.ca (Faculty of Graduate Studies)

item.title: Systematic and Scoping Reviews: Setting your team up for success (Workshop 2)
item.description:
Systematic and Scoping Reviews: Setting your team up for success (Workshop 2)

This workshop is part of a series. Please register for Workshop 1 to be included in workshops 2 and 3.

Planning an evidence synthesis (e.g. systematic/scoping reviews, meta-analyses) project? Brock Library offers a three-part interactive workshop series for faculty-led teams who have a research questions and are ready to start their project! 

Each team will be paired with a librarian for personalized support, culminating in a completed evidence synthesis work plan. For optimal outcomes, attendance at all three online sessions is important.  

Registration opens Monday, March 10 on ExperienceBU.  

Space is limited to 5 research teams, although multiple team members may attend. Only one team member needs to register for their team. Questions: dsmith@brocku.ca 

Presented by Brock Librarians: Kymberly Ash, Denise Smith, Sonia Dhaliwal, and Elizabeth Yates. 

From Tuesday, April 22, 2025 12:00 PM to 1:30 PM EDT at Online.

item.title: Immigration In-Person Appointments
item.description:
Immigration In-Person Appointments

Are you an international student? Do you have questions about your immigration documents (study permit, work permit, visa, eTA) or work eligibility in Canada?  If so, book an appointment at the Brock International Centre!

 

How to book a time?

 

  1. One day before the advising session, book your specific time slot 
  • You will not be able to see time slots any earlier than 7 days beforehand
  • Time slots are first come, first served
  • If your schedule changes, please remember to cancel so that the appointment is available for another student

 

  1. Arrive at the International Centre(2nd Floor) at least 5 minutes before your time slot and feel free to sit in one of the available chairs in the welcome reception area while you wait for the immigration advisor to come greet you.

 

You will have the opportunity to meet one of Brock International's licensed immigration advisors and ask questions about your immigration documents/process in a 1-on-1 setting!

From Tuesday, April 22, 2025 1:30 PM to 2:30 PM EDT at Brock International Centre 2nd Floor.

item.title: 2SLGBTQIA+ ACADEMIC & AUTHOR STORYTELLING: WRITING TOWARD SOCIAL JUSTICE
item.description:
2SLGBTQIA+ ACADEMIC & AUTHOR STORYTELLING: WRITING TOWARD SOCIAL JUSTICE
RSVP through EventBrite Here
 
Supported by the Department of Educational Studies Equity and Social Justice Committee at Brock University, this event aims to amplify the voices of 2SLGBTQ+ academics/authors and explore the connections between writing and activism.  
 
In this online event, queer writers will share their experiences of storytelling in academic writing and creative writing. Drawing on intersectional identities, these 2SLGBTQTIA+ panelists will discuss their storytelling practices in writing, and reflect on the ways that storytelling can be used as a tool for positive social change.
 
All are welcome to attend. A Q&A session will be held after the panelists’ remarks.

From Tuesday, April 22, 2025 5:00 PM to 6:30 PM EDT at Online.

item.title: New International Student Orientation (Virtual)
item.description:
New International Student Orientation (Virtual)

Welcome to Brock! 

 

Our New International Student Orientation is aimed at getting new international students familiar with the Canadian and academic culture, as well as policies and services at Brock that are available throughout their studies to ensure that they succeed as Brock Badgers! 

 

7:30-9:00am You can expect to learn about: 

  • Academic Culture & Success (e.g., course formats & expectations, academic integrity) 
  • Immigration Essentials 
  • UHIP & Health Insurance
  • Wellness Resources
  • Living in Niagara & Transportation
  • Important Dates 
  • Q & A Session at the end

 9:00-10:00am Stay online to join our Social Hour - connect with other students and make friends before you even arrive in Canada!

 

What are you waiting for? Come join us and start your academic studies with the tools you will need to succeed! 

 

NOTE: The first part of this session is mandatory for all new, international students at Brock this Winter 2025 and is hosted ONLINE on MS Teams. The Social Hour is optional.

From Wednesday, April 23, 2025 7:30 AM to 10:00 AM EDT at Online.

item.description:
Building Better Research - Exploring the Scholarship of Teaching and Learning (SoTL): Researching Your Classroom Practice

Join members of the Centre for Pedagogical Innovation (CPI) to discuss the Scholarship of Teaching and Learning (SoTL). This webinar will discuss SoTL, a research area which invites professionals to examine their classroom practice through systematic inquiry. We will also share information about the programs available through CPI related to SoTL including the Chancellor's Chair for Teaching Excellence and the Faculty Fellows in Accessibility.

item.description:
Office of the Registrar and Enrolment Services - Monthly Information Session

The Office of the Registrar & Enrolment Services (ORES) is excited to pilot a new initiative to engage with the campus community in new and collaborative ways, effectively offering supportive and timely information.

Our team is thrilled to be launching a monthly program inviting department chairs, program directors, faculty and administrative staff, designed to aid campus partners in preparing for upcoming deadlines and requirements of the ORES, review key BrockDb system functions, and provide just-in-time training and information relevant to departments.

item.title: Save the Date: GRADflix Competition and Showcase (tentative)
item.description:
Save the Date: GRADflix Competition and Showcase (tentative)

Gradflix encourages grad students to share their research through a creative short video (60 seconds or less) for a chance to win cash prizes. The competition invites master’s and doctoral students across disciplines to showcase their current research to non-specialist audiences. Graduate students and postdoctoral fellows can submit their videos for the competition until April 13 (extended deadline).

The Brock and larger Niagara Community is invited to join us on April 23 for a GRADflix video showcase and winner announcement in Rankin Family Pavilion 216 (the Research Impact Hub). Come support and celebrate Brock's amazing graduate researchers!

Come back in April to RSVP for this event!

 

Accessibility:

Rankin Family Pavilion (RFP) 216 is on the ground floor and has accessible entrances. RFP 216 has dimmable lighting and movable furniture that can be adjusted on request. There are accessible washrooms in the RFP 200-level Atrium (behind the red wall). FGSPA staff will be available throughout the event to provide assistance. If you have any specific accommodation requests, including seating location, please reach out to Danielle Morris-O'Connor at dmorrisoconnor@brocku.ca.

From Wednesday, April 23, 2025 3:00 PM to 5:00 PM EDT at RFP 216.

De-stress and unwind from the hustle and bustle of graduate student life by spending a relaxing afternoon colouring or painting. Plus build your overnight oats, take it to go to have for breakfast. item.title: Brightspace for TAs (Asynchronous)
item.description:
Brightspace for TAs (Asynchronous)

In this workshop TAs will get to interact with and explore various tools in the Brightspace environment. The workshop explores the ways that tools within Brightspace support teaching and learning activities such as assessment and evaluation, discussion, and communications with students.

 

Brock University TAs, marker-graders, tutorial leaders, lab demonstrators, and course coordinators are invited to join us for our online asynchronous workshop.

 

Registration for this workshop will automatically enroll you in the CPI Teaching and Learning Brightspace site, where workshop credits are tracked through Awards. 

 

Completion of this workshop will give you one credit towards your Certificate(s) in Teaching and Learning in Higher Education.

 

From Monday, January 6, 2025 8:00 AM to Friday, April 25, 2025 11:45 PM EDT at Online.

item.title: Graduate Writing Café
item.description:
Graduate Writing Café

Need motivation to get work done? All graduate students are welcome to join our writing community every Tuesday from 11:00am-1:00pm, either online or in-person.   

 

Writing Café is a space to work alongside other grad students. There is also a writing specialist available, if you need help. Free snacks and hot beverages will be provided. 

From Tuesday, April 29, 2025 11:00 AM to 1:00 PM EDT at RFP 302/Online.
item.author: graduatestudies@brocku.ca (Faculty of Graduate Studies)

item.title: Graduate Writing and Academic Support Drop-ins
item.description:
Graduate Writing and Academic Support Drop-ins

All graduate students are welcome to stop by our drop-in support sessions every Tuesday from 11am-1pm, either online or in person. No appointment necessary. Sessions are limited to 30 minutes (or 20 minutes if students are waiting). First come, first served. 

 

Our Graduate Academic Support Specialist will be available every week to help with writing and general academic skills. 

 

There may also be special topic weeks with other Support Specialists available (see list below). If you would like to see other supports available during these drop-ins, please contact Danielle Morris-O'Connor (dmorrisoconnor@brocku.ca) to make a request. 

 

Weekly Supports: 

  • Academic Writing 
  • Presentations 
  • Proposals 
  • Literature Reviews 
  • Time Management 
  • Note-taking 
  • Reading Strategies 
  • Utilizing Feedback 

From Tuesday, April 29, 2025 11:00 AM to 1:00 PM EDT at RFP 302/Online.

item.title: Immigration In-Person Appointments
item.description:
Immigration In-Person Appointments

Are you an international student? Do you have questions about your immigration documents (study permit, work permit, visa, eTA) or work eligibility in Canada?  If so, book an appointment at the Brock International Centre!

 

How to book a time?

 

  1. One day before the advising session, book your specific time slot 
  • You will not be able to see time slots any earlier than 7 days beforehand
  • Time slots are first come, first served
  • If your schedule changes, please remember to cancel so that the appointment is available for another student

 

  1. Arrive at the International Centre(2nd Floor) at least 5 minutes before your time slot and feel free to sit in one of the available chairs in the welcome reception area while you wait for the immigration advisor to come greet you.

 

You will have the opportunity to meet one of Brock International's licensed immigration advisors and ask questions about your immigration documents/process in a 1-on-1 setting!

From Tuesday, April 29, 2025 1:30 PM to 2:30 PM EDT at Brock International Centre 2nd Floor.

item.title: Literacy Link Niagara Volunteer Tutors
item.description:
Literacy Link Niagara Volunteer Tutors

As a non-profit learning network organization, Literacy Link Niagara supports local adult education (literacy and basic skills) programming. Our programs are free and accessible to any adult in Niagara.

Values

  • Put learners first
  • Provide high quality, effective services
  • Treat all people with dignity, respect and care
  • Act with integrity, honesty and compassion
  • Foster co-operation
  • Support lifelong learning
  • Be accountable and transparent
  • Be creative
  • Be accessible

 

If you are interested in supporting adults with literacy in our community, contact Literacy Link Niagara at ed@literacylinkniagara.ca

From Monday, October 21, 2024 12:00 PM to Wednesday, April 30, 2025 1:00 PM EDT at St Catharines.

item.description:
STI Testing - Get Tested, Stay Informed & Protect Yourself

Did you know that 80% of STIs have no symptoms?

Looking for free, confidential STI testing? Look no further! Drop by the Wellness HUB in TH 134, just off Market Hall, every Wednesday from 11 am to 3 pm. Our welcoming and non-judgemental environment ensures your privacy while Niagara Public Health Nursing staff provides comprehensive testing services. Take charge of your sexual health and visit us each Wednesday – no appointment necessary!

 

From Friday, May 2, 2025 11:00 AM to 3:00 PM EDT at TH 134 (off of Market Hall).

item.title: New International Student Welcome
item.description:
New International Student Welcome

Attention all New International students in the Spring 2025 term!

 

The days before the start of term are often full of challenges: You may be just arriving to Canada, visiting the campus for the first time, and/or adjusting to a lot of new things around you. Brock International is here to support you and to ensure your transition is the best that it can be!

 

We will be hosting a different events designed to support all new international students with opportunities to connect with others and ask any additional questions before the Spring term starts Monday, April 28th!

 

Events include:

8:30am - Check In & Breakfast

  • Check in to the event, enjoy a grab and go breakfast, and socialize with other students

9:00-9:30am – Brock International Introductions

  • Meet the Brock International team
  • Meet your fellow international students
  • Learn about upcoming events, how to get involved, important dates, and the next steps to make your transition to Brock a great one!

9:30-10:30am – Vision Boards & Goal Setting

  • Set some positive intentions and goals for your first term
  • Enjoy a social get-together with other international students at Brock
  • Ask questions to Brock International Staff

10:30-11:30am – Campus Exploration

  • Go on an adventure across campus locating different student services
  • See the campus in the process and ask questions about the campus

12:00pm – Lunch

  • Grab some free lunch before continuing with the rest of your day
  • Take an opportunity to eat with a new friend or chat with the Brock International team

12:00pm and onwards – Move-in to Residence

  • It’s time to make your way to your new home away from home - Move in to Residence and begin to get settled!
  • Get help from volunteers to move in to Residence

 

Please RSVP if you plan to attend any part of the day; We look forward to meeting you in person!

 

Brock University protects your privacy and your Personal Information. Personal Information is collected under the authority of The Brock University Act, 1964, section 3 and in accordance with the Freedom of Information and Protection of Privacy Act ("FIPPA"). The information collected will be shared with the Niagara Folk Arts Multicultural Centre for the purposes of International Student Connect session registration and participation. Direct any questions about this collection to the Student Supports Team, of the International department at Brock University at  
https://brocku.ca/international/

From Sunday, May 4, 2025 8:30 AM to 1:00 PM EDT at Brock International Centre.

Volunteers Needed: New International Student Welcome

Hi Badgers! We need the help of some incredible volunteers to help and welcome our incoming International Students this Spring. 

 

Brock International will be hosting events designed to support all new international students with opportunities to connect with others and the Brock community on Sunday, April 27th. This is an incredible opportunity to make our new Badgers feel seen and supported, as well as a chance to make new friends and learn about Brock's global community! ♥

 

Volunteers will be helping from 8am-2pm. More information on timing and tasks coming soon.

 

If you are interested, make sure to RSVP! 

From Sunday, May 4, 2025 8:00 AM to 2:00 PM EDT at Brock University.

item.title: Spring Perspectives on Teaching and Learning 2025
item.description:
Spring Perspectives on Teaching and Learning 2025

Faculty, Instructors, Teaching Assistants and community partners are invited to join the Centre for Pedagogical Innovation’s Spring Perspectives on Teaching and Learning.  

Featured Plenary Presentation

Academic Integrity in a Postplagiarism Era: Prioritizing Pedagogy instead of Punishment

Dr. Sarah Eaton, Professor and Chair, Leadership, Policy, and Governance, University of Calgary

Detailed Schedule information will be available on the CPI website

This day will include sessions on a variety of topics and opportunities to hear from faculty and instructors about their innovative practices in teaching and learning.  

  • Generative AI in your teaching,  
  • trauma-informed practices,  
  • educational technologies,  
  • innovative teaching practices,  
  • open education practice and resources, 
  • and accessibility.

Schedule

9:30 Welcome and Registration 

10:00-10:50 Plenary Presentation 

11:00am-12:00pm Breakout Sessions (including workshops and 15-minute innovative teaching practice shares) 

12-1 Lunch (provided) and Poster Session 

1:00pm-3:00pm Breakout Sessions (including workshops and 15-minute innovative teaching practice shares) 

From Monday, May 5, 2025 10:00 AM to 3:00 PM EDT at GSB Atrium.

item.title: Systematic and Scoping Reviews: Setting your team up for success (Workshop 3)
item.description:
Systematic and Scoping Reviews: Setting your team up for success (Workshop 3)

This workshop is part of a series. Please register for Workshop 1 to be included in workshops 2 and 3.

Planning an evidence synthesis (e.g. systematic/scoping reviews, meta-analyses) project? Brock Library offers a three-part interactive workshop series for faculty-led teams who have a research questions and are ready to start their project! 

Each team will be paired with a librarian for personalized support, culminating in a completed evidence synthesis work plan. For optimal outcomes, attendance at all three online sessions is important.  

Registration opens Monday, March 10 on ExperienceBU.  

Space is limited to 5 research teams, although multiple team members may attend. Only one team member needs to register for their team. Questions: dsmith@brocku.ca 

Presented by Brock Librarians: Kymberly Ash, Denise Smith, Sonia Dhaliwal, and Elizabeth Yates. 

From Tuesday, May 6, 2025 12:00 PM to 1:30 PM EDT at Online.

item.description:
GNCC - May 2025 Business After 5

Join us for an evening of food, fun, networking, and prizes!

  • Admission for GNCC members is FREE, please register online
  • Meet and mingle with Chamber members and their guests
  • Find out more about our host!
  • Light refreshments served
  • A great place to relax and do business!

GNCC members are welcome to donate a prize to the draw to get some exposure, simply bring the prize with you and give to GNCC staff when you register. Prize exposure is available to GNCC members only.


Tickets:

Tickets are complimentary for GNCC members.


Accessibility: 

We are committed to providing a welcoming and inclusive experience for all attendees. If you have any accessibility requirements or specific accommodations that would enhance your participation in the event, please let us know when registering.


Photo Disclaimer:

GNCC reserves the right to photograph its events, and from time to time we use these photos in our publications. By registering for any of our events, you understand and acknowledge that your photograph may be taken and used, per GNCC discretion.

 

This event is FREE for Brock students.  Brock University is a member of the Greater Niagara Chamber of Commerce and students are able to attend this event for FREE.  

From Tuesday, May 6, 2025 5:00 PM to 7:00 PM EDT at Whirlpool Pub + Lounge.

item.title: Job Opportunity - Night Security at the Scientifically Yours Conference.
item.description:
Job Opportunity - Night Security at the Scientifically Yours Conference.

Residence Night security - To receive an application for the position please RSVP to this event and one will be mailed to you. 

DESCRIPTION
The role of the Residence Night Security is to be awake and patrol the halls and common residence spaces from 11 pm on Thursday May 8, 2025 to 7 am on Friday, May 9, 2025.


 Attend a 1 hour orientation meeting on Monday, May 5th to train on University and Residence Policies, emergency procedures and responsibilities.
 Assist other Night Security personnel when aiding participant(s).
 Supervise participants during their stay in residence overnight.

QUALIFICATIONS

Previous experience in supervision of youth in Brock’s Residences or living in residence is an asset. A Vulnerable Sector Clearance Check with the Regional Police will be required of all Residence Night Security. Clearance Checks received in Sept 2024 for 2024/2025 school year will be accepted. Note: Positions require a valid vulnerable sector clearance which can take 8 weeks to obtain.

 

Positions Available for the 2025 Conference and Associated Stipends:

 

  1. (2) Residence Night Security (Stipend of $150 + $25 Tim Hortons gift card; 8 hours)

 

About SY Conference:

 Scientifically Yours provides an opportunity for students to learn more about science in a university setting. Students will learn about career opportunities from professionals who have careers in the sciences, including medicine, university research and industry. Everyone will participate in six science and mathematics projects, gaining hands-on laboratory experience.

The two-day event also includes recreational activities, networking and an opportunity to dine with a number of professional scientists. The workshops will be conducted with the assistance of Brock University student mentors, staff and faculty members.

 

From Thursday, May 8, 2025 11:00 PM to Friday, May 9, 2025 7:00 AM EDT at Brock University Campus.

Date: May 9, 2025
Time: 1-2pm
Format: Microsoft Teams (Online)
Link to Join: Click here to join the session

Target Audience: BBA Year 2 and Above Students who missed the first session in March

Event Description:
Are you ready to declare your concentration? Join us for an informative session where we’ll guide you through the concentration declaration process, answer your questions, and provide tips for making the right academic choices. This session is optional for all BBA students who are planning to declare or change their concentration.

Whether you're unsure about which concentration to choose or simply want to understand the requirements and benefits of each option, this session will provide you with the clarity you need to move forward confidently. Don't miss out on this opportunity to set yourself up for success!

Topics covered in the session include:

item.title: Hike With Us (Cancelled)
item.description:
Hike With Us
Did you know that Brock University is part of the UNESCO Niagara Escarpment Biosphere, which currently runs west from Niagara, and then north to Tobermory, extending more than 700 kilometers!
 
Join us to explore this amazing area through a guided hike through the Quarry Naturalization Site right on campus!
 
Meet at the International Centre building in the parking lot area. Bring comfortable shoes, weather appropriate clothing and bug spray. In case of rain or inclement weather, any cancelations will be sent through email.

Safety reminders:
- Please wear appropriate footwear for the terrain - hiking shoes recommended or other comfortable shoes (if it has rained recently, the ground may be muddy. Waterproof shoes are strongly recommended).
-The hike will take place along the trail. For your safety, do not go off the trail or into any surrounding water.
-Tick repellant/bug spray and SPF 30+ is strongly recommended.
-Bring a water bottle to ensure you are properly hydrated throughout the hike. 
 
The total running time of the hike is approximately 45 minutes. 
 
Some helpful resources to review:
Health and Safety Considerations 
  • Tick Safety: https://www.niagararegion.ca/living/health_wellness/disease-prevent/ticks/default.aspx 
  • Heat Warnings: https://www.niagararegion.ca/living/health_wellness/inspection/highheat.aspx  
  • Sun safety: https://www.niagararegion.ca/living/health_wellness/sunsafety/sun-safety-tips.aspx 
  • Proper footwear: https://www.niagaraparks.com/things-to-do/trail-etiquette-and-safety#:~:text=Rugged%2C%20winding%20trails%20can%20be,hiking%20to%20maintain%20energy%20levels. 


Please note: Photos/videos may be taken throughout the hike by Brock staff. These may be used by Brock University for marketing and publicity in our publications, on our website and in social media including Instagram. Please advise the leading Brock staff member or other photographer if you do not want your photo taken or to be used. Comments and concerns can be sent to: isa@brocku.ca 

From Wednesday, May 14, 2025 12:00 PM to 1:00 PM EDT at Meet at the International Centre Parking Lot.

item.title: Building Better Research: Introduction to evidence synthesis research – including systematic reviews and scoping reviews
item.description:
Building Better Research: Introduction to evidence synthesis research – including systematic reviews and scoping reviews

Evidence synthesis projects such as systematic or scoping reviews use rigorous and comprehensive methods to gather, synthesize and analyze data from large sets of primary studies. While increasingly popular in many academic disciplines, these are time- and resource-intensive team projects and may not be appropriate for all research objectives. This session will cover the key steps and tools in conducting a systematic or scoping review, present alternative review types, and discuss how to identify the review type most suited to your research question.

From Wednesday, May 14, 2025 12:00 PM to 1:00 PM EDT at Online.

item.title: Immigration In-Person Appointments
item.description:
Immigration In-Person Appointments

Are you an international student? Do you have questions about your immigration documents (study permit, work permit, visa, eTA) or work eligibility in Canada?  If so, book an appointment at the Brock International Centre!

 

How to book a time?

 

  1. One day before the advising session, book your specific time slot 
  • You will not be able to see time slots any earlier than 7 days beforehand
  • Time slots are first come, first served
  • If your schedule changes, please remember to cancel so that the appointment is available for another student

 

  1. Arrive at the International Centre (2nd Floor) at least 5 minutes before your time slot and feel free to sit in one of the available chairs in the welcome reception area while you wait for the immigration advisor to come greet you.

 

You will have the opportunity to meet one of Brock International's licensed immigration advisors and ask questions about your immigration documents/process in a 1-on-1 setting!

From Wednesday, May 14, 2025 1:00 PM to 1:50 PM EDT at Brock International Centre 2nd Floor.

item.title: GNCC - June 2025 Business After 5
item.description:
GNCC - June 2025 Business After 5

Join us for an evening of food, fun, networking, and prizes!

  • Admission for GNCC members is FREE, please register online
  • Meet and mingle with Chamber members and their guests
  • Find out more about our host!
  • Light refreshments served
  • A great place to relax and do business!

Prizes:

GNCC members are welcome to donate a prize to the draw to get some exposure, simply bring the prize with you and give to GNCC staff when you register. Prize exposure is available to GNCC members only.

Tickets:

Tickets are complimentary for GNCC members.

Accessibility: 

We are committed to providing a welcoming and inclusive experience for all attendees. If you have any accessibility requirements or specific accommodations that would enhance your participation in the event, please let us know when registering.

Photo Disclaimer:

GNCC reserves the right to photograph its events, and from time to time we use these photos in our publications. By registering for any of our events, you understand and acknowledge that your photograph may be taken and used, per GNCC discretion.

 

This event is FREE for Brock students.
Brock University is a member of the Greater Niagara Chamber of Commerce
and students are able to attend this event for FREE.

From Tuesday, June 3, 2025 5:00 PM to 7:00 PM EDT at Telecable.ca & Security.

item.title: Immigration In-Person Appointments
item.description:
Immigration In-Person Appointments

Are you an international student? Do you have questions about your immigration documents (study permit, work permit, visa, eTA) or work eligibility in Canada?  If so, book an appointment at the Brock International Centre!

 

How to book a time?

 

  1. One day before the advising session, book your specific time slot 
  • You will not be able to see time slots any earlier than 7 days beforehand
  • Time slots are first come, first served
  • If your schedule changes, please remember to cancel so that the appointment is available for another student

 

  1. Arrive at the International Centre (2nd Floor) at least 5 minutes before your time slot and feel free to sit in one of the available chairs in the welcome reception area while you wait for the immigration advisor to come greet you.

 

You will have the opportunity to meet one of Brock International's licensed immigration advisors and ask questions about your immigration documents/process in a 1-on-1 setting!

From Friday, May 30, 2025 10:00 AM to Wednesday, June 4, 2025 10:50 AM EDT at Brock International Centre 2nd Floor.

item.title: Hike With Us
item.description:
Hike With Us
Did you know that Brock University is part of the UNESCO Niagara Escarpment Biosphere, which currently runs west from Niagara, and then north to Tobermory, extending more than 700 kilometers!
 
Join us to explore this amazing area through a guided hike through the Quarry Naturalization Site right on campus!
 
Meet at the International Centre building in the parking lot area. Bring comfortable shoes, weather appropriate clothing and bug spray. In case of rain or inclement weather, any cancelations will be sent through email.

Safety reminders:
- Please wear appropriate footwear for the terrain - hiking shoes recommended or other comfortable shoes (if it has rained recently, the ground may be muddy. Waterproof shoes are strongly recommended).
-The hike will take place along the trail. For your safety, do not go off the trail or into any surrounding water.
-Tick repellant/bug spray and SPF 30+ is strongly recommended.
-Bring a water bottle to ensure you are properly hydrated throughout the hike. 
 
The total running time of the hike is approximately 45 minutes. 
 
Some helpful resources to review:
Health and Safety Considerations 
  • Tick Safety: https://www.niagararegion.ca/living/health_wellness/disease-prevent/ticks/default.aspx 
  • Heat Warnings: https://www.niagararegion.ca/living/health_wellness/inspection/highheat.aspx  
  • Sun safety: https://www.niagararegion.ca/living/health_wellness/sunsafety/sun-safety-tips.aspx 
  • Proper footwear: https://www.niagaraparks.com/things-to-do/trail-etiquette-and-safety#:~:text=Rugged%2C%20winding%20trails%20can%20be,hiking%20to%20maintain%20energy%20levels. 


Please note: Photos/videos may be taken throughout the hike by Brock staff. These may be used by Brock University for marketing and publicity in our publications, on our website and in social media including Instagram. Please advise the leading Brock staff member or other photographer if you do not want your photo taken or to be used. Comments and concerns can be sent to: isa@brocku.ca 

From Wednesday, June 11, 2025 12:00 PM to 1:00 PM EDT at Meet at the International Centre Parking Lot.

Quoting and Paraphrasing

When should you use quotes to summarize ideas, and when is the right opportunity to use your own words?

The goal of this workshop is to help students understand when and how to use either quotes or paraphrasing in written assignments. Participants will evaluate writing samples, gain practical experience integrating research, and receive feedback while completing different practice activities.

item.title: Eco Leaders Program Support
item.description:
Eco Leaders Program Support

Heartland Forest launched an exciting new Eco Leaders program for teens (ages 14-18) with up to 20 participants that combines hands-on environmental restoration projects with fun outdoor recreational activities, and they would love your help!

The program runs every other Thursday from 3:30 to 5:30 pm, with some weekend activities. If you're passionate about the environment and enjoy working with teens, this could be a great opportunity to make a difference! 

 

As a volunteer, you would assist with program preparation and delivery along with a staff member. Please keep in mind that this is a physically active and outdoor program at Heartland Forest. This program may also include visits to offsite locations. A driver's license is preferred. Since you would be volunteering with children, you will need Vulnerable Sector Clearance (this cost will be reimbursed after supporting 4 sessions).

 

If you are interested in volunteering, please email Lisa Staton at lisa.staton@heartlandforest.org

 

From Thursday, August 22, 2024 3:30 PM to Thursday, June 12, 2025 5:30 PM EDT at Heartland Forest Nature Experience.

item.title: Physical Activity for All: An Afternoon with the Experts
item.description:
Physical Activity for All: An Afternoon with the Experts

Brock's Centre for Healthy Youth Development through Sport are thrilled to be hosting Bruce Kidd, PhD for an engaging talk building off his recent book: ‘Educating the Body: why physical education is needed more than ever’. His talk will cover topics including promoting sport and physical activity for all; equity, diversity and inclusion initiatives; and disability and inclusive through adaptive physical activity. Dr. Kidd is a renowned scholar, community activist and seasoned and respected academic leader.

Following this address, will be an interactive poster session. We can learn so much from each other when we listen and share. Whether you are a researcher in the field, a community coach or physical educator who wishes to share best practices, or provincial sport organization representative who aims to inform the field of a new policy change, we want to hear from you—the experts!

Please submit an abstract that aligns with the theme: Physical Activity for All.

Register here. 

From Tuesday, June 24, 2025 1:00 PM to 4:00 PM EDT at Brock University .

The total running time of the hike is approximately 45 minutes. 
 
Some helpful resources to review:
Health and Safety Considerations 
  • Tick Safety: https://www.niagararegion.ca/living/health_wellness/disease-prevent/ticks/default.aspx 
  • Heat Warnings: https://www.niagararegion.ca/living/health_wellness/inspection/highheat.aspx  
  • Sun safety: https://www.niagararegion.ca/living/health_wellness/sunsafety/sun-safety-tips.aspx 
  • Proper footwear: https://www.niagaraparks.com/things-to-do/trail-etiquette-and-safety#:~:text=Rugged%2C%20winding%20trails%20can%20be,hiking%20to%20maintain%20energy%20levels. 


Please note: Photos/videos may be taken throughout the hike by Brock staff. These may be used by Brock University for marketing and publicity in our publications, on our website and in social media including Instagram. Please advise the leading Brock staff member or other photographer if you do not want your photo taken or to be used. Comments and concerns can be sent to: isa@brocku.ca

item.description:

Join us for an evening of food, fun, networking, and prizes!

Prizes:

Tickets:

Accessibility: 

We are committed to providing a welcoming and inclusive experience for all attendees. If you have any accessibility requirements or specific accommodations that would enhance your participation in the event, please let us know when registering.


Photo Disclaimer:

GNCC reserves the right to photograph its events, and from time to time we use these photos in our publications. By registering for any of our events, you understand and acknowledge that your photograph may be taken and used, per GNCC discretion.

item.title: Challenger Baseball volunteers needed!
item.description:
Challenger Baseball volunteers needed!

If you are looking for something to do in the summer and enjoy working with children, this is for you!

 

Challenger Baseball is a non-competitive form of the traditional sport of baseball. By accessing a
buddy system (1:1 or 2:1) support is provided to the athletes at the level in which they can play the
sport.

 

Volunteers support skill building with a focus on grounding, fielding, throwing, and batting. During
each practice, volunteers will assist leading small group and large group activities to work on these
skills. The overall goal is to play a game of baseball. No score is kept, everyone gets to bat each
inning, and everyone is a winner!

 

This is a weekly commitment on Monday evenings from May 26 to July 28 (no session June 30) from 4:30 to 7:00pm

 

Onboarding tasks include:

• Submitting an online application
• Virtual interview
• Review of Centre policies
• E-Learning Orientation
• Submitting a Vulnerable Sector Police Check (VSPC). A VSPC must have been completed within the last nine (9) months to be accepted. If you do not have a current VSPC the Centre will provide you with a letter to get one.
• Challenger Baseball volunteer training will take place Monday, May 12 from 5 to 7 p.m. at Lancaster Park in St. Catharines.

 

 

If you are interested, please apply through this link. Questions and/or concerns can be directed to Holly Lismanis at holly.lismanis@niagarachildrenscentre.com

From Monday, May 12, 2025 4:30 PM to Monday, July 28, 2025 7:00 PM EDT at Lancaster Park, 31 Wood St. St Catharines.
item.location: Lancaster Park, 31 Wood St. St Catharines

item.title: Hike With Us
item.description:
Hike With Us
Did you know that Brock University is part of the UNESCO Niagara Escarpment Biosphere, which currently runs west from Niagara, and then north to Tobermory, extending more than 700 kilometers!
 
Join us to explore this amazing area through a guided hike through the Quarry Naturalization Site right on campus!
 
Meet at the International Centre building in the parking lot area. Bring comfortable shoes, weather appropriate clothing and bug spray. In case of rain or inclement weather, any cancelations will be sent through email.

Safety reminders:
- Please wear appropriate footwear for the terrain - hiking shoes recommended or other comfortable shoes (if it has rained recently, the ground may be muddy. Waterproof shoes are strongly recommended).
-The hike will take place along the trail. For your safety, do not go off the trail or into any surrounding water.
-Tick repellant/bug spray and SPF 30+ is strongly recommended.
-Bring a water bottle to ensure you are properly hydrated throughout the hike. 
 
The total running time of the hike is approximately 45 minutes. 
 
Some helpful resources to review:
Health and Safety Considerations 
  • Tick Safety: https://www.niagararegion.ca/living/health_wellness/disease-prevent/ticks/default.aspx 
  • Heat Warnings: https://www.niagararegion.ca/living/health_wellness/inspection/highheat.aspx  
  • Sun safety: https://www.niagararegion.ca/living/health_wellness/sunsafety/sun-safety-tips.aspx 
  • Proper footwear: https://www.niagaraparks.com/things-to-do/trail-etiquette-and-safety#:~:text=Rugged%2C%20winding%20trails%20can%20be,hiking%20to%20maintain%20energy%20levels. 


Please note: Photos/videos may be taken throughout the hike by Brock staff. These may be used by Brock University for marketing and publicity in our publications, on our website and in social media including Instagram. Please advise the leading Brock staff member or other photographer if you do not want your photo taken or to be used. Comments and concerns can be sent to: isa@brocku.ca 

From Wednesday, May 14, 2025 12:00 PM to Wednesday, August 13, 2025 1:00 PM EDT at Meet at the International Centre Parking Lot.

item.title: GROW-on-the-GO Mobile Market Volunteer
item.description:
GROW-on-the-GO Mobile Market Volunteer

GROW Community Food Literacy Centre is looking for five compassionate, energetic, and resourceful volunteers to join our GROW-on-the-GO Mobile Market team, and support our mission to address food insecurity and foster community well-being in Niagara.

The GROW-on-the-GO Mobile Market program is a low-cost market, which serves locations throughout the Niagara Region. We focus on providing access to affordable fruits and vegetables, in locations where people may not be able to otherwise access or afford fresh foods.

 

Locations and Times

- Thursdays 12:00pm-4:00pm (locations in Niagara Falls)

- Fridays 10:00am-3:00pm (locations in Fort Erie and Port Colbourne)

 

Volunteer tasks include:

- helping shoppers to pick out produce

- assisting with check-out

- re-stocking produce bins

- being a friendly-face in the community

 

Requirements:

- Friendly, enthusiastic, enjoys engaging with the public, and has a positive attitude
- Ability to work effectively with diverse populations and understand the social and cultural context of program users’ lives
- Passionate about community food systems, social justice, and equity
- Detail oriented, organized and enjoys problem-solving
- Able to lift 40 lbs plus
- Access to a vehicle/reliable transportation



Preferred Skills:
- Knowledge of or strong interest in food security, food literacy, or local food systems
- Ability to speak another language

 

If you are interested in volunteering, please follow this link to apply

 

 

About GROW Community Food Literacy Centre:
"GROW Community Food Literacy Centre is a charity serving the Niagara Region. Our goal is to assist and empower those with barriers to accessing and benefiting from good, healthy food. We run GROW Market and GROW-on-the-GO Mobile Market, low-cost markets where low-income members can access fresh fruits and vegetables, bread and pantry items at very affordable prices. We also have cooking classes and outreach opportunities to teach food and kitchen skills, build community, and develop food literacy."

Learn more about GROW: www.growcflc.com

About GROW-on-the-GO:
"GROW-on-the-GO Mobile Market is a new program to bring fresh produce to low-income neighbourhoods, who may not have access to affordable, fresh foods. We currently serve 5 locations on Thursdays and Fridays during the day, and GROW-on-the-GO Volunteers will play a key role in implementing this program across the region!"

From Friday, March 21, 2025 12:00 PM to Friday, October 31, 2025 4:00 PM EDT at Niagara Falls, Fort Erie, or Port Colbourne .
item.location: Niagara Falls, Fort Erie, or Port Colbourne
item.author: community@brocku.ca (Brock University Volunteer Association)

item.title: Pelham Art Festival Treasurer
item.description:
Pelham Art Festival Treasurer

Pelham Art Festival (PAF) is a not-for-profit organization that has donated over $500,000.00 to local library systems and scholarships for budding artists in the Niagara region. They are looking for a treasurer for their committee. If you have basic knowledge of bookkeeping/accounting this opportunity might be for you!

 

 

There are minimal transactions during 11 months of the year, with less than 2 hours of work per month. Most of your effort would be needed on the last day of their art show in May. The treasurer would provide calculations for commissions to be paid from artists in order to make donations. They use a square POS system and receive payments via credit card, debit or e transfer. The have a caring committee ready to offer volunteers support in this role.

 

 

More information can be found here.

If this opportunity interests you, please email pelhamartfest@gmail.com

 

From Sunday, June 1, 2025 6:30 PM to Friday, May 1, 2026 7:30 PM EDT at Pelham (Fonthill).
item.author: community@brocku.ca (Brock University Volunteer Association)
